title: Risis logo
content:
What font was squashed to create this logo?   
 ![risis](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117202037im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/69626.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Rolling Rock Beer logo - (similar to) Flange {Yves}](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117202037/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10401 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) Geometric sans "Spring" - Insignia {Mike Y} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117202037/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10394 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Stephen Coles

comments.content: It doesn't look squashed to me. If it was, the horizontal part of the S curves would be thinner. Unless it was corrected after squashing it. But I think it's more likely custom.

Oh you're so right, Mark. I really passed this off too quickly as   
mechanically scaled.

How interesting. Why the interest in Risis, Scoles?   
   
Btw, your logo is slightly different from the one on their website.   
   
 [http://www.risis.com.sg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117202037/http:/www.risis.com.sg/)

Hmm. Interesting. First I've heard of the company. The ID was a   
FontShop customer request.
Hahahahaha, that's how I started out doing this splendid waste of time. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20081117202037im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
